title: Q25 - Organization of Ideas
prompt: (25) The writer wants to add a concluding sentence that ties this story to a bigger idea. Which of the following is the best concluding sentence to add?
feedback: The best concluding sentence to add is: “My dad and I still laugh about our April Fool’s Day pranks; having a family tradition of fun has brought us close together over the years.” This sentence connects the story about the narrator with its effects over the years. The sentences “My dad is still trying to get me back for that triumph!” and “My dad isn’t mad and laughs with me, but next year, he becomes the victor” don’t connect the story with a bigger idea. The sentence about the history of April Fool’s Day doesn’t have a connection with the story.
